page.title: 14 COMMUNICATIONS 2
page.content: ...only gave me 48 hours notice. I was annoyed by the way it was done, and I Wrote and told them either to pay me a fair ground rent or move it. They wrote back offering me five pence a year!" Having informed them that he did not consider this a fair offer, Mr. Tester told the parish council what was happening. The parish clerk said that "after a lot of difficulty" permission had been given by the highway authority for a call box to be sited next to a verge between Heathfield Avenue and Heathfield Close. The difficulty arose because Telecom originally sought permission from the wrong authorities. First they wrote to Berkshire County Council, and then to South Oxfordshire District Council, even though the parish council "reminded"them that Oxfordshire ...
